reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?
reply.analysis: The app clearly states that it may collect, store, and process some data, including personal data.
reply.reference: We develop and publish iOS applications and we may collect, store and process some data, including personal data. This privacy policy (“Privacy Policy”) sets out the main principles on which the data collected from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us. URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d

source_documents.excerpt:
PRIVACY POLICY
We develop and publish iOS applications and we may collect, store and process some data, including personal data. This privacy policy (“Privacy Policy”) sets out the main principles on which the data collected from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us. This Privacy Policy also aims to remind you about your rights and to provide you with all the elements you need to exercise them.
If you have any questions related to this Privacy Policy or our practices around pr...

you want to make a purchase in the application, you may do this with the help of payment system provided by AppStore (managed by Apple) and integrated into the apps. The in-app payment system is managed by the AppStore administration or its authorized partner. Under no circumstances do we collect or process any information related to your payment instruments, such as bank card number, its validity term or your name as written on it.
III. DATA RETENTION
1. By using our Platforms, you consent for ...

data and the legal bases we rely on in each case.
When you visit our Platforms, you may provide us with the following types of data, and we may collect and process such data in accordance with this Privacy Policy, as follows:
Contact Data (To respond to communications that you send to us)
This may include your name and your email address. This information will be collected by us if you communicate with us, for example if you use the links on our Platforms to communicate with us via email.
Corres...

identifying you or your device across our Platforms.
To identify and respond to potential risks to the security of our Platforms (for example spammers, phishing attempts, screen scraping and other actions which may violate our Terms of Use).
This includes your IP address, your device’s unique identifier details, browser details including version, device operating system, geo-location, time zone setting and time/date of access requests, the amount of data transmitted and the requesting provider. ...

data to comply with any legal or regulatory obligation, we may share your personal data with a regulator or law enforcement agency.
VI. THIRD PARTY WEBSITES
Our Platforms may contain links to third party websites. If you follow a link to a third-party website, please note that this Privacy Policy does not apply to those websites. We are not responsible or liable for the privacy policies or practices of those websites, so please check their policies before you submit any data to those websites.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects Contact Data, Correspondence Data, Session Data, Cookie Data, Preference Data, and Payment Data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states the various types of data collected by the app, hence providing comprehensive information on the data collection process.
reply.reference: Contact Data (To respond to communications that you send to us). URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d, Correspondence Data (To help address issues you raise with us and to improve the Platforms and our services). URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d, Session Data (To administer, maintain and improve the Platforms and our services, including identifying you or your device across our Platforms). URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d, Cookie Data. URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d, Preference data (To infer your interests, including serving and suggesting content that you might like, and tailoring advertising to you based on such preferences). URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d, Payment data. URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use by mentioning the reasons for collecting data such as responding to communications, improving services, and addressing security risks.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states the purposes for which data is collected, including responding to communications, improving services, and ensuring security on the platform.

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data. The user has the right to request the erasure of personal data under certain circumstances, and to object to or restrict the processing of personal data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that users have the right to request the erasure of personal data and to object to or restrict the processing of personal data. This indicates that users can opt out of data collection or delete data.
reply.reference: To request your personal data is erased where we do not have a compelling reason to continue to process such personal data in certain circumstances; To object to, or restrict, our processing of your personal data in certain circumstances; URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with third-party service providers for hosting, administration, maintenance, email services, payment processing, fraud prevention, analytics, and customer service. Additionally, data may be shared with third parties for marketing purposes and to comply with legal or regulatory requests.

content: Providers of systems and services for hosting and maintaining Platforms

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly mentions sharing data with various third parties for different purposes, including hosting, marketing, and legal compliance.
reply.reference: Third party service providers; Providers of systems and services that we use to host, administer and maintain our Platforms; Email service providers; Payment processors; Fraud prevention vendors; Analytics, customer service providers; Third party marketing automation platforms; Regulator or law enforcement agency. URL: https://bit.ly/3HFZS2d
